selected_quotes: Antibiotics vs Surgery for Acute Appendicitis
Very thoughtful summary of the issues regarding #antibiotics v #appendectomy for #appendicitis @JAMASu…
A first for anonymous bloggers? My blog has been cited in a JAMA Surgery article.
@JAMASurgery Feb 2016, BTK is mentioned and cited in viewpoint about appendicitis! Thanks
#Antibiotics vs Surgery for Acute Appendicitis. @jdimick1 @krchhabra offer thoughts on a complex clinical question

news.title: Appendicitis: Longer Antibiotic Treatment May Not Help
news.summary: Patients with acute complicated appendicitis who received 5 days of postoperative antibiotic treatment after laparoscopic appendectomy surgery did not have a reduction in infectious complications relative to patients receiving only 3 days of…

blogs.title: Appendicitis and shared decision-making

blogs.title: The problem with shared decision-making in appendicitis
blogs.summary:
A JAMA Surgery Viewpoint recently suggested that because of the findings of a Finnish randomized trial, surgeons now should give patients with appendicitis a choice between an appendectomy or treatment with antibiotics.
The paper acknowledged my criti

facebook.title: Antibiotics vs Surgery for Acute Appendicitis
facebook.summary: This Viewpoint reviews the study results of and reactions to the Salminen et al acute appendicitis trial and provides recommendations for surgeons who will be confronted by patients questioning whether they need surgery.
